DMM's method to get high stats on mogis and 29 other MR3 breeds
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Raising Methods: DMM's method to get high stats on mogis and 29 other MR3 breeds
By DigMoshMogi on Sunday, November 25, 2001 - 10:12 am:

First battle early try alternating your battle weeks battle-venture then you can still get gains on those weeks but you may need to rest anyways after battles. It is recommended you give your monster a heart to help with these battles but not necessary. I doubt that a monster could max in one gen. but if you train another monster normally it should give enough to a 2nd gen. to make a maxxed monster.

Spend 2000G on all ventures first do all noisy halls. Then search elsewhere if your monster is stressed/fatigued after venture reset and try again.

Early in live give your monster the best composite in food edging more for nutrition. In the second stage on try for a 2,4 or 2,3 in food. This hasn?t been proven but I believe that lower favorites later in life make your monster more likely to succeed.

If your monster fails try other drills ending with a life drill if all other drills fail and punish accordingly.

Here?s the first no rest method we don?t know the numbers yet so cant figure out the math yet but doing it successfully will give 50% more in training gains and you get the bonuses that really add up in ventures. Venture gains will be about 240/year when training skills and 480/year when not training skills. I would suggest don?t settle for less than 5 per venture with noisy halls and 10 without but that?s your choice.

Thanks to DP for coming up with his method inspiring Lisa?s MR1 method inspiring my method. And Torey for helping me get this written up and anyone that decides to try this method. And Fenrick for listening to me talk about my mogi. Please ,if you don?t mind, try this method and give me feed back .

Happy ranching
